ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: We ransomed him with a mighty sacrifice
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: So We ransomed him for a great sacrifice,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: And We ransomed him with a mighty sacrifice,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: We ransomed his son with a great sacrifice
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And We rescued him in exchange of a great sacrifice. (The sacrifice of Ibrahim and Ismail – peace be upon them – is commemorated every year on 10, 11 and 12 Zil Haj).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And We ransomed him with a Feat sacrifice.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: And We ransomed him with a mighty sacrifice,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: Then We ransomed him with a tremendous victim.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: We ransomed him with a great sacrifice,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And We ransomed him with a mighty victim.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: Then We ransomed him with a great sacrifice,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And We ransomed him with a momentous sacrifice:
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice (i.e. a ram);
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: So, We ransomed him with a mighty sacrifice,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And We redeemed him with a great sacrifice.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And We ransomed him with a great sacrifice,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [37:107] Then We ransomed him, the one whom he had been commanded to sacrifice, namely, Ishmael or Isaac — two different opinions — with a mighty sacrifice, [a mighty] ram from Paradise, the same one that Abel had offered as as sacrifice: Gabriel, peace be upon him, brought it and the lord Abraham sacrificed it as he cried, Allāhu akbar, ‘God is Great’.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (Then We ransomed him with a tremendous victim) We ransomed him with a fat ram.
